definitions: feeling or showing an urgent need or desire for something important
extremely serious, dangerous, or difficult requiring immediate action or attention
willing to do anything regardless of risk because other options have failed
examples: The desperate mother searched everywhere for her missing child
He made a desperate attempt to save his failing business
The refugees were in desperate need of food and shelter
The company faces a desperate financial situation this quarter
In a desperate move, she bet all her savings on one race
The desperate criminal took hostages to escape from police

definitions: separated by a great amount of space from something else
far away in time, either past or future from the present
not friendly or forthcoming; showing emotional separation or lack of warmth
examples: The distant mountains looked blue in the afternoon haze
We could hear distant thunder approaching from the west
In the distant past, dinosaurs roamed the earth freely
Our distant descendants may live on other planets someday
She gave him a distant smile and continued walking
He seemed distant and preoccupied during the entire dinner

definitions: relating to Italy, its people, culture, language, or things originating from there
examples: We enjoyed authentic Italian pasta at the new restaurant
She's studying Italian art from the Renaissance period

definitions: containing or providing many specific facts, features, or particulars about something
done with or showing great attention to completeness and accuracy
examples: The architect provided detailed blueprints for the new building
She wrote a detailed report about the accident scene
The detective conducted a detailed investigation of the crime
Please give me a detailed explanation of your methodology

definitions: having the color between red and yellow like a ripe orange fruit
relating to or flavored with the citrus fruit called orange
examples: She wore a bright orange dress to the party
The orange sunset painted the sky in beautiful colors
This orange juice is freshly squeezed from Florida oranges
The cake has a delicious orange frosting on top

definitions: currently functioning, operating, or continuing without stopping at the present time
happening continuously or in succession without interruption over a period
relating to or used for the activity of running as exercise
examples: Keep the engine running while I check the tires
The running water helped wash away all the dirt
She maintained a running commentary throughout the entire game
He kept a running total of expenses in his notebook
I need new running shoes for the marathon next month
The running track was recently resurfaced with new material

definitions: covering or affecting a large area, distance, or amount of space
large in amount, scope, or range; very thorough and comprehensive in coverage
examples: The fire caused extensive damage throughout the forest region
The farm includes extensive fields of wheat and corn
She conducted extensive research before writing her doctoral thesis
The museum has an extensive collection of ancient artifacts

definitions: in good physical condition, healthy, and strong through regular exercise
suitable, appropriate, or good enough for a particular purpose or situation
examples: She stays fit by running five miles every morning
You need to be physically fit to join the military
This book isn't fit for young children to read
He's not fit to be a leader after that scandal

definitions: relating to Canada, its people, culture, or things originating from there
examples: Canadian winters can be extremely cold and snowy
She loves Canadian maple syrup on her pancakes

definitions: suggested or put forward for consideration, discussion, or adoption but not yet approved
examples: The proposed budget cuts will affect many departments
They're discussing the proposed changes to company policy

definitions: relating to or expressing love and strong emotional attraction between people
characterized by idealism, imagination, and emphasis on emotion over practical matters
examples: They had a romantic dinner by candlelight last night
Paris is considered one of the most romantic cities
He has romantic notions about living off the land
The romantic poets emphasized emotion and nature's beauty

definitions: relating to the ancient language of Rome or derived from it
relating to the peoples or countries using Romance languages, especially Latin American
examples: Students must study Latin grammar for two years minimum
Many English words have Latin roots and origins
Latin music filled the air during the street festival
She specializes in Latin American history and politics

definitions: conforming to accepted standards of morality, propriety, or good taste
of acceptable or satisfactory quality, though not outstanding; fairly good
examples: He's a decent person who always helps his neighbors
It's not decent to speak that way about others
The hotel room was decent for the price we paid
She makes a decent living as a freelance writer

definitions: helping or supporting someone in their work, especially in a subordinate position
examples: She works as an assistant manager at the store
The assistant director helped coordinate the entire production

definitions: relating to or involving the use of violence and intimidation for political aims
examples: The terrorist attack shocked the entire nation yesterday
Security forces prevented a terrorist plot from succeeding

definitions: made of or consisting of wood from trees as the primary material
stiff, awkward, or without natural ease in movement, manner, or expression
examples: The old wooden bridge creaked under our weight
She carved beautiful designs into the wooden table
His wooden performance ruined the entire play last night
She gave a wooden smile that fooled no one

definitions: unable to speak, especially as a permanent condition; mute
showing lack of intelligence or good judgment; stupid or foolish
examples: The illness left him temporarily dumb for several weeks
Sign language helps dumb children communicate with others
That was a really dumb mistake to make twice
Don't ask such dumb questions during the presentation

definitions: causing physical pain, hurt, or bodily discomfort when experienced
causing emotional or mental suffering, distress, or difficulty to endure
examples: The injection was painful but necessary for treatment
Her painful arthritis makes walking difficult every morning
Watching the documentary about poverty was painful
It's painful to see him struggle with addiction

definitions: producing or capable of producing much noise or sound volume
attracting attention by being unpleasantly colorful, showy, or ostentatious in appearance
examples: The music was too loud for normal conversation
A loud explosion shook the windows of nearby buildings
She wore a loud Hawaiian shirt to the office
His loud tie clashed terribly with his suit

definitions: lasting, existing, serving, or effective for only a limited time; not permanent
examples: She found temporary work during the holiday season
The road closure is only temporary while they repair

definitions: firmly fixed, supported, or balanced; not shaking, wobbling, or likely to fall
regular, even, and continuous in development, frequency, or intensity without fluctuations
examples: Keep the ladder steady while I climb up
She has steady hands perfect for delicate surgery
The company showed steady growth over five years
He maintained a steady pace throughout the marathon

definitions: happening quickly and unexpectedly without warning or apparent preparation time
examples: A sudden rainstorm caught everyone without umbrellas
His sudden departure surprised all of his colleagues

definitions: considered in relation or proportion to something else rather than absolutely
belonging to the same family by blood or marriage connections
examples: The relative cost of living varies between cities
Success is relative to your starting point in life
All her relative pronouns were used correctly in writing
We invited relative strangers to fill the wedding venue

definitions: relating to the mental processes of perception, memory, judgment, reasoning, and thinking
examples: Children show rapid cognitive development in early years
The disease causes severe cognitive impairment in patients

definitions: feeling or showing appreciation and thanks for something received or done
examples: I'm grateful for all your help during difficult times
She felt grateful to have such supportive friends

definitions: extremely large in amount, scale, degree, or intensity beyond normal expectations
extremely good, excellent, or impressive in quality or achievement
examples: The earthquake caused tremendous damage to the city
They put tremendous effort into organizing the event
She did a tremendous job on her first project
The performance received tremendous applause from the audience

definitions: projecting out from something or sticking out so as to be easily seen
important, famous, or well-known in a particular area or field
examples: His prominent nose was his most distinctive feature
The house sits on a prominent hill overlooking town
She's a prominent scientist in cancer research
Several prominent politicians attended the charity event

definitions: happening, produced, or appearing once every week or by the week
examples: Our weekly team meetings are every Monday morning
She writes a weekly column for the local newspaper

definitions: not genuine or real but made to appear so; counterfeit or fraudulent
examples: The painting turned out to be a fake copy
She wore fake diamonds to the costume party

definitions: relating to the international athletic competition called the Olympic Games
examples: She won three Olympic gold medals in swimming
The Olympic village houses athletes from every nation

definitions: able to wait calmly for a long time or accept delays without becoming annoyed
receiving or registered to receive medical treatment from healthcare providers
examples: Be patient while the computer processes your request
She's very patient with her young students' mistakes
The patient arrived early for her surgery appointment
Patient records must be kept strictly confidential always

definitions: needing someone or something else for financial, emotional, or other support
determined, influenced, or controlled by something else as a conditioning factor
examples: Young children are completely dependent on their parents
He became dependent on painkillers after his accident
Your grade is dependent on your final exam score
Plant growth is dependent on sunlight and water

definitions: relating to Ireland, its people, culture, language, or things originating from there
examples: We celebrated with traditional Irish music and dancing
Irish literature has produced many famous writers

definitions: coming after something in time; following in order or succession
examples: All subsequent meetings will be held on Tuesdays
The initial success led to subsequent opportunities

definitions: causing or likely to cause disagreement, public dispute, or heated discussion
examples: The politician's controversial statements divided public opinion
They decided to avoid controversial topics at dinner

definitions: belonging to or characteristic of the dominant trend, style, or culture; conventional
examples: The band went from underground to mainstream success
Mainstream media covered the story extensively last night

definitions: recognizably different in nature or quality from something else of similar type
physically separate and disconnected from something else though often similar
examples: Each wine has a distinct flavor and aroma profile
There's a distinct possibility of rain this afternoon
The building has three distinct sections with different functions
Scientists identified four distinct species in the sample

definitions: having or showing the ability to learn, understand, and think about things quickly and well
examples: She's an intelligent student who grasps concepts quickly
Dolphins are highly intelligent marine mammals

definitions: coming after or less important than something primary or first in order
of lesser importance, rank, or value compared to something else
examples: She teaches at a secondary school in the suburbs
The secondary effects of the medication are mild
Cost is a secondary concern compared to safety here
He played a secondary role in the company's success

definitions: able to be agreed upon, approved, or tolerated; satisfactory though not outstanding
examples: Your proposal is acceptable to all board members
This behavior is not acceptable in our workplace

definitions: experienced, felt, or done by two or more parties toward each other equally
examples: They ended their relationship by mutual agreement
Mutual respect is essential for a good partnership

definitions: having a clear meaning that can be understood; making sense
having real importance, purpose, or value that makes something worthwhile
examples: The data shows meaningful patterns in consumer behavior
She gave me a meaningful look across the room
He wants to do meaningful work that helps others
They had a meaningful conversation about their future

definitions: relating to or supporting communism as a political and economic system
examples: The communist party ruled the country for decades
He studied communist theory in his political science class

definitions: better, greater, or higher in quality, achievement, or ability than others
higher in rank, status, or position within an organizational hierarchy
examples: This wine is superior to the one we had yesterday
Her superior knowledge of physics impressed the committee
You should report this issue to your superior officer
He acts superior to everyone else in the department

definitions: done by or belonging to all members of a group working together as one
examples: The collective effort of the team won the championship
They made a collective decision to support the proposal

definitions: happening, moving, or acting with great speed in a very short time
examples: The company experienced rapid growth in Asian markets
Her rapid response saved the child from drowning

definitions: simple in form without decoration, ornament, or special features
easy to see, hear, or understand; clear and obvious without ambiguity
relating to or being a large area of flat land without trees
examples: She prefers plain white walls without any artwork
He ordered a plain hamburger with no toppings
The meaning of her words was plain to everyone
It's plain that he doesn't want to cooperate
Buffalo once roamed the great plains in huge herds
The plain stretched endlessly under the vast sky

definitions: average in amount, intensity, quality, or degree; neither too much nor too little
avoiding extremes in behavior, politics, or opinions; reasonable and not excessive
examples: We had moderate success with our marketing campaign
The doctor recommended moderate exercise three times weekly
She holds moderate political views on most issues
He's known for his moderate approach to problem solving

definitions: functioning, running, or being used in the process of working at present
examples: The operating costs of the factory increased significantly
Check the operating instructions before using the machine

definitions: remaining after all deductions, costs, or losses have been subtracted from gross
relating to or being a mesh of cords or wires woven together
examples: Her net income after taxes is fifty thousand dollars
The company's net profit increased by ten percent
The fisherman repaired his net before going to sea
They installed a net around the trampoline for safety
